newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX May Brent tests $19.00 after NYMEX weakness.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX May Brent tests $19.00 after NYMEX weakness.

text.p: May Brent crude futures were testing $19.00 per barrel on SIMEX at midday on Tuesday, pressured down by the weakness of NYMEX.
May Brent was quoted at $18.85/$19.19 per barrel with value seen at $18.95/$19.00 based on a May/May arbitrage with NYMEX of $1.35.
Brokers said NYMEX crude prices had been pushed lower on ACCESS earlier to test sentiment and that bears would target the seven-month low of $18.68, hit on March 3.
"This market looks like it is going to go lower," one broker said.
May in London settled at $19.38 on Thursday ahead of the long bank holiday weekend.
But NYMEX May crude fell 29 cents to $20.41 per barrel on Monday, when London and SIMEX were still closed.
A broker said resistance was now placed at $20.40 for NYMEX May crude. May was last traded at $20.35, down six cents from New York's close on Monday.
Brokers said news that Shell's production in Nigeria was getting back to normal, would take out some minor support for prices.
